description.narrative: By 2022, social sector institutions will have strengthened their capacities to efficiently and innovatively design, manage, monitor and evaluate public policies in areas linked to the Cooperation Program.

sector.narrative: Inter-sectoral coordination and collaboration on violence, exploitation and abuse
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, social sector institutions will have strengthened their capacities to efficiently and innovatively design, manage, monitor and evaluate public policies in areas linked to the Cooperation Program.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF continued to reinforce replicable and coordinated protection models aimed towards achievement of peace, justice and solid institutions to end all forms of abuse, exploitation, trafficking and violence against children and adolescents, through national agreements and social participation. Priority was given to regions with greater vulnerability due to a high incidence of violence and population minorities such as Indigenous peoples, migrants, or those living in extreme poverty. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of innovative violence prevention models implemented
Number of SSLPs (individuals, NGOs and institutions) supported by UNICEF in the implemention of innovative violence prevention models.
Number of SSLPs (individuals, NGOs and institutions) supported by UNICEF in the implemention of innovative violence prevention models.

Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan.

baseline.value: The country has a National Plan against Violence, its monitoring will be done through institutional commitments, in the CNNA.

target.value: 2022:The office will provide support for the implementation of the Plan, through the establishment of monitoring mechanisms.
